declaration.code: func setOutputSettings(_ outputSettings: [String : Any]?, for connection: AVCaptureConnection)

overview:
## Discussion

For details on output settings, see [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/video-settings] for video connections and [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/audio-settings] for audio connections.

On iOS, your output settings dictionary may only contain keys listed returned from the [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureMovieFileOutput/supportedOutputSettingsKeys(for:)] method. If you specify any other key, the system throws an invalid argument exception. Additionally, the value you specify for [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVVideoCodecKey] should be present in the [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureMovieFileOutput/availableVideoCodecTypes] array. If you specify [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVVideoCompressionPropertiesKey], you must also specify a valid value for [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVVideoCodecKey].

On iOS, the [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureMovieFileOutput/outputSettings(for:)] method always provides a fully populated dictionary. If you call [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureMovieFileOutput/outputSettings(for:)] with the intent of overriding a few of the values, you must exclude keys that aren’t supported before calling [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureMovieFileOutput/setOutputSettings(_:for:)]. When providing an [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVVideoCompressionPropertiesKey] sub dictionary, you may specify a sparse dictionary. A movie file output object always fills in missing keys with default values for the current capture session configuration.

# setOutputSettings(_:for:)

**Instance Method**

Sets the options the output uses to encode media from the given connection while recording.

## Declaration

```swift
func setOutputSettings(_ outputSettings: [String : Any]?, for connection: AVCaptureConnection)
```

## Parameters

- **outputSettings**: A dictionary of output settings. Pass an empty dictionary to specify that the format of the media from the connection shouldn’t change before writing to the file. Pass `nil` to specify that the session preset determines output format.
- **connection**: The connection delivering the media to encode.

## Discussion

For details on output settings, see [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/video-settings] for video connections and [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/audio-settings] for audio connections.

On iOS, your output settings dictionary may only contain keys listed returned from the [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureMovieFileOutput/supportedOutputSettingsKeys(for:)] method. If you specify any other key, the system throws an invalid argument exception. Additionally, the value you specify for [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVVideoCodecKey] should be present in the [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureMovieFileOutput/availableVideoCodecTypes] array. If you specify [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVVideoCompressionPropertiesKey], you must also specify a valid value for [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVVideoCodecKey].

On iOS, the [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureMovieFileOutput/outputSettings(for:)] method always provides a fully populated dictionary. If you call [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureMovieFileOutput/outputSettings(for:)] with the intent of overriding a few of the values, you must exclude keys that aren’t supported before calling [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureMovieFileOutput/setOutputSettings(_:for:)]. When providing an [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVVideoCompressionPropertiesKey] sub dictionary, you may specify a sparse dictionary. A movie file output object always fills in missing keys with default values for the current capture session configuration.

## Managing output settings

- **supportedOutputSettingsKeys(for:)**: Returns a list of supported keys to use in the output settings dictionary.
- **outputSettings(for:)**: Returns the settings the output uses to encode media from the specified connection.
- **availableVideoCodecTypes**: The video codecs types the output supports for recording movie files.
